document.masterDocTitle: Redefinition of the millipede subgenus Megaphyllum sensu stricto Verhoeff, 1894 and neotype designation for Megaphyllum austriacum (Latzel, 1884) (Myriapoda: Diplopoda: Julida: Julidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Redefinition of the millipede subgenus Megaphyllum sensu stricto Verhoeff, 1894 and neotype designation for Megaphyllum austriacum (Latzel, 1884) (Myriapoda: Diplopoda: Julida: Julidae)

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 4 a – l. Megaphyllum projectum. (4 a – d) M. p. deubeli male from Băile Borşa, Maramureş Mts, Romania: right gonopods, (4 a) posterior and (4 b) mesal views; (4 c) left promere, meso-posterior view; (4 d) left opisthomere, lateral view. (4 e and 4 g – i) Megaphyllum projectum kochi male from Bukova, Malé Karpaty, Slovakia: (4 e) gonopods, posterior view; penis, (4 g) posterior and (4 h) right lateral views. (4 i) M. p. kochi female from Sanssouci, Germany: right vulva, posterior view (setae omitted). (4 f and 4 j – l) M. p. projectum male [originally Julus austriacus syntype, ZMB 1846]: (4 f) right gonopods, lateral view; (4 j) gonopods, posterior view; (4 k) right gonopods, mesal view. (4 l) M. p. projectum female from Haragistya, Aggtelek National Park, Hungary: right vulva, posterior view (setae omitted). Abbreviations: ap: anterior process, asp: anterior process of the solenomere, ca: central ampulla, ct: connecting tube; pa: posterior ampulla, pp: posterior process, psp: posterior process of the solenomere, sl: serrated lobe, P: promere. Scale bars: 0.2 mm.

Material examined. Inv. Nr. 8133, 4♂ , Ungarn , Siebenbürgen, Kroatien , [ Hungary , Romania and Croatia ], 1919 , don. Latzel,
Ch. austriacus sensu Latzel
det. Attems (NHMW);
Hungary
:
1 ♂
, 1 ♀, Fényi-erdő, Bátorliget, from under barks, leaf-litter sifting and singling, 2011.05 . 28 ., leg. Novák J. (HNHM);
Romania
:
1 ♂
,
1 juv.
, Medgyes [Mediaş], leg. Dr. Tömösváry Ö., 830 / 1888 , Rev. Loksa 55 / 1955 (HNHM);
Serbia
: ZMB 1846 :
2 ♂
, 4 ♀,
13 juv.
,
Julus austriacus
Syntypen , “
J. fasciatus C. L. Koch Name
ungiltig!”, Serbien (MNB);
Slovakia
:
1 ♂
, Körtvélyes [Hrušov], leg. Raisz G., 830 / 1888 ,
Julus austriacus
var. nigrescens
det. Dr. Daday, Revid. Loksa 56 / 1955 (HNHM).

Diagnosis. Differs from the most similar subspecies
M. p. kochi
by having larger and more bulging promeres ( P ) (see
Fig. 4 j
in comparison with 4 e) and better developed apical serrated lobe ( sl ) of the promere—discernible not only from posterior but also from meso-posterior view (
Fig. 4 j
).
Body length and height: males: 25.9–53.9mm , 1.8–3.2mm ; females: 30–51.9mm , 2.6–4.2mm .

Remarks. Nominotypical subspecies of the
Megaphyllum
type species, distributed in the southern half of the species’ distribution range, with a northern border formed by the Carpathians and the Alps; its taxonomic status has been recently clarified by Lazányi & Korsós ( 2011 ).
